mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: Clarysville Hospital. Civil War Records of Samuel West, Physician
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Patient Record for Alben, John
mdRecord.dcterms:spatial: Piqua, Miami Co. [Piqua, Miami County, Ohio]
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Patient Name: Alben, John Patient Age: 24. Marital Status: Single. Diagnosis: Gun shot flesh wound left foot. Musket bullit [bullet] entered about middle of the metatarsal bone of the second toe passing obliquely backward about to inches to a rest over the head of the metatarsal bone of the great toe. Integuments lacerated. Location Wounded: Cedar Creek, Va. Date Wounded: 1864/10/19. Nature of Wound: Musket ball. Treatment: Saber wound of middle finger of right hand. Received in action Beverley Ford, VA 1864/06/09 - involving the proxymal [proximal] joint and extending to the second joint of the finger severing the external tendon of the finger ensuring loss of use of the finger .
